erhua variant of 打哈哈[da3 ha1 ha5]

sentences.chinese: 欧盟里男人和女人都是“打哈哈”。

sentences.english: I am not joking. I'm serious.
sentences.chinese: 我可没打哈哈，我是认真的。
欧盟里男人和女人都是“打哈哈”。

definition: to play dumb/to slack off (idiom)
to ridicule/to mock
to answer/to respond/to converse
to give a hollow laugh/to force a smile/forced laugh/CL:聲|声[sheng1]
all smiles/smiling mischievously or ingratiatingly
interruption/to interrupt (esp. talk)/to change the subject
to worm one's way into being friends with sb (usually derogatory)
to smile apologetically or obsequiously
to talk officiously/to assume the air of a functionary/to talk in official jargon
to talk irresponsibly/to talk nonsense
to bicker/to argue for the sake of arguing/to carry on poles (together with sb else)/to carry a coffin on poles
to mediate/to broker a compromise
to chatter/nonsense/blather
to help to resolve a dispute/to smooth things over
to put on a fake smile (idiom)/to smile insincerely
